sentences.sContent: The company admitted that it had been a tough year.
sentences.sCn: 公司承认那是艰难的一年。

sentences.sContent: Tough decisions will have to be made.
The reporters were asking a lot of tough questions .
sentences.sCn: 记者们问了很多难以回答的问题。

sentences.sContent: (= a difficult decision ) , but we had to cancel the game because of the weather.
sentences.sCn: 尽管是一个艰难的决定，但由于天气不好我们只得取消比赛。

sentences.sContent: I find his books pretty tough going (= difficult to read ) .
Gage predicted the president’s proposal would be a tough sell (= something that is difficult to persuade someone about ) before Congress.
sentences.sCn: 盖奇预言总统的提议在国会很难通过。

synos.tran: 艰苦的，困难的；坚强的，不屈不挠的；坚韧的，牢固的；强壮的，结实的

phrases.pCn: [美国口语]勇敢地承受；坚持到底
非常坚强的人；不易动感情的人；自信者
大胆果断的人；暴躁的人
严厉的爱（指为起到帮助作用而严厉地对待有问题的人）

remMethod.val: “塔夫”→像塔一样的壮夫→强健的

trans.tranCn: 坚韧的； 吃苦耐劳的；棘手的， 困难的；强健的；粗暴的， 粗鲁的
trans.tranOther: difficult to do or deal with
